basics.name: Leonardo Mannini
basics.label: MSc Student / AI Researcher / AI Engineer
basics.summary:
ðŸŽ“ MSc student in Artificial Intelligence @Unibo | Research intern @FBK (E3DA unit) | AI Engineer @GradientLabs

I am currently working on the development and optimization of neural network architectures for embedded systems, with a specific focus on real-time audio processing and edge AI. My research interests include audio classification, speech synthesis on constrained hardware, and neural inference optimization techniques for low-memory platforms.

I also have experience in designing AI services for NLP and computer vision applications, integrating both classical and modern deep learning techniques into production-ready pipelines.

work.name: Bruno Kessler Foundation (FBK)
work.summary: Working within the E3DA research unit.
highlights: Developing and prototyping AI models for tiny and edge platforms
Bringing neural networks inside audio & speech processing/synthesis pipelines on tiny devices

work.name: Gradient Labs
highlights: Developing and deploying AI services for computer vision and NLP applications
Implementing and optimizing LLM systems for production environments

work.name: DHL Express Italy SRL
highlights: Implemented and managed robust network infrastructure
Provided technical support and troubleshooting for hardware, software, and network issues

courses: Foundational content on algorithms, mathematical methods, machine learning, planning and decision-making
Specialized courses in NLP, computer vision, architectures for AI, Cryptography and Knowledge Engineering
Additional focus on cognitive neuroscience, ethical and legal foundations of AI
Focus on digital signal processing and audio applications
Thesis: Project of a virtual synthesizer in C++ on the JUCE platform
Core focus on programming, electronics, and control systems
Specialized in classical repertoire and music theory

awards.title: Award for best project of the Programme
awards.awarder: Polytechnic University of Marche (Musical Instruments Engineering PDP)

awards.title: Winner of the Italian Rapid U16 Chess Championships

projects.name: Virtual Synthesizer (Bachelor's Thesis)
projects.summary: Developed a virtual synthesizer using C++ and JUCE framework with audio processing algorithms and MIDI control.
highlights: Implemented real-time audio processing and modular synthesis architecture

projects.name: Sound Classifier (Personal Project)
projects.summary: Developed an Environmental Sound Classification system using PyTorch and CNNs that converts audio to mel spectrograms for acoustic analysis.
highlights: Implemented a VGG-style neural network achieving 93.7% accuracy on ESC-10 dataset
Real-time streaming classification capabilities using sliding window and majority voting

projects.name: Hiring Assistant (Web Application)
projects.summary: Developed web platform for automated evaluation of video interviews and CVs.
highlights: Implemented AI-powered assessment tools and user authentication system

projects.name: Food Product Recognition (University Project)
projects.summary: Created hybrid system combining traditional computer vision and deep learning.
highlights: Achieved 92% accuracy in product classification and detection

projects.name: Sexism Detection in Social Media (University Assignment)
projects.summary: Developed and compared BiLSTM and Twitter-RoBERTa models. Conducted extensive experiments with Llama-3.1 and Qwen2-7B for in-context learning.
highlights: Analyzed performance across zero-shot and few-shot settings

projects.name: LeoLM (Personal Project)
projects.summary: Built Raspberry Pi-based voice assistant using OpenRouter APIs.
highlights: Implemented wake word detection and natural language understanding
